ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I am often confused about what emotion I am feeling.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: It is difficult for me to find the right words for my feelings.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I have physical sensations that even doctors don't understand.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I am able to describe my feelings easily.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I prefer to analyze problems rather than just describe them.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: When I am upset, I don' know if I am sad, frightened, or angry.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I am often puzzled by sensations in my body.

ElementDescription: I prefer to just let things happen rather than to understand why they turned out that way.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I have feelings that I can't quite identify.

ElementDescription: Being in touch with emotions is essential.

ElementDescription: I find it hard to describe how I feel about people.

ElementDescription: People tell me to describe my feelings more.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I don't know what's going on inside me.

ElementDescription: I often don't know why I am angry.

ElementDescription: I prefer talking to people about their daily activities rather than their feelings.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Disagree; 2 = Moderately Disagree; 3 = Neither Disagree Nor Agree; 4 = Moderately Agree; 5 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I prefer to watch "light" entertainment shows rather than psychological dramas.

ElementDescription: It is difficult for me to reveal my innermost feelings, even to close friends.

ElementDescription: I can feel close to someone, even in moments of silence.

ElementDescription: Looking for hidden meanings in movies or plays distracts from their enjoyment.

ElementDescription: TAS total score
Factor 1 - Difficulty Identifying Emotions

Factor 3 - Externally-Oriented Thinking
Timepoint/visit label
